message_1: Find all values of x that satisfy the inequality 2x + 5 > 13.
message_2:
To find all values of x that satisfy the inequality 2x + 5 > 13, we need to isolate x. 

Step 1: Subtract 5 from both sides of the inequality.
2x + 5 - 5 > 13 - 5
2x > 8

Step 2: Divide both sides of the inequality by 2.
2x / 2 > 8 / 2
x > 4

So, all values of x that satisfy the inequality 2x + 5 > 13 are x > 4.
